December 2011, Revised May 2013                                                                                               Proposed Staged Servicing and Implementation Strategy | 17
01097                                                                                                                             Seaton Urban Area | Central Pickering Development Plan
        9)   Seaton Trail Network                                                              connectivity to the development. The timing for the internal local road
                                                                                               network would be tied to the timing of development of the individual parcels.
             The Neighbourhood Plans propose a network of primary and secondary
             recreational trails throughout the Seaton Urban Area, as discussed in the
             Related Studies section above. The Phase 1 primary trail network (also referred
             to as Primary Neighbourhood Connecting Trails as per Pickering OPA 22) and
             corresponding trailheads are shown in Figure 1.1. The trailheads act as
             gateways within each community to the various connecting trails. The
             Landowners will construct the trailheads located within their development
             parcels. The locations of trails and trail heads are subject to change pending
             OMB decisions, and will be addressed through the NFSSR. The necessity, timing,
             and funding of the Primary Neighbourhood Connecting Trails will be
             determined by the Province (OILC), as manager of the NHS, in consultation with
             the City of Pickering and other potentially interested public agencies such as
             TRCA.


        10) Employment Land Servicing

             From the perspective of water and wastewater servicing, the 80 hectare
             Employment lands abutting Highway 407 will be serviced by designated local
             watermains connected to the Zone V pumping station and watermain along
             Sideline 26. Sanitary services are to be made available by the extension of the
             sanitary sewer from the westerly trunk as mentioned in Section 1 above and
             included within the servicing program for the Phase 1 Living Area.

             Access to these employment lands will initially be from Sideline 26 and Highway
             7, and Sideline 24. Interim access to Highway 407 may be provided at the Brock
             Road interchange via Highway 7. The employment collector road along the
             south limit of the development discussed in Section 5 will provide additional

01097                                                                                                                                  Seaton Urban Area | Central Pickering Development Plan
            be serviced with a pumping station and forcemain system due to elevation   CHAPTER C – PLANNING CONDITIONS
            constraints.
                                                                                            In order to ensure that Regional spine water and wastewater systems are provided
                                                                                            at the appropriate times within the development cycle of each living and
                                                                                            employment area phase, it is proposed that specific conditions of plan of subdivision
                                                                                            approval and the use of holding (H) provisions on the zoning of the land specifically
                                                                                            referencing this SSIS be provided.

                                                                                            For the purposes of living and employment areas of Phase 1, appropriate
                                                                                            development, front-funding or servicing agreements will be completed and
                                                                                            executed, and the extension of Regional spine services and road systems as
                                                                                            provided in this SSIS will commence prior to the release of building permits.
                                                                                            Appropriate conditions of plan of subdivision approval will secure these
                                                                                            requirements, and no holding provisions for Phase 1 are necessary.

                                                                                            For all living and employment area phases subsequent to Phase 1, it is
                                                                                            recommended that a holding provision be imposed, as provided for in Pickering OPA
                                                                                            22. The removal of the holding designation will be conditional on the City of
                                                                                            Pickering and the Region of Durham, in consultation with the Region of York, being
                                                                                            satisfied with respect to:

                                                                                            A.      the completion of the transportation planning study described in section
                                                                                                    11.74 (b) of Pickering OPA 22 and implementation of transportation
                                                                                                    improvements recommended by the study that are required to support
                                                                                                    development beyond Phase 1, if any; and

                                                                                            B.      the implementation of the trunk water and sanitary services that are
                                                                                                    required to support development beyond Phase 1.

  32i               • Extends approximately 150m north within the          • No drainage feature; therefore not applicable   • Location acceptable.

                    • Located in an area that currently is a driveway to                                                       impacted
                      concrete recycling facility house.

ROADS CHECKLIST FOR NHS ROAD CROSSING 15b – COLLECTOR ROAD, WEST DUFFINS
CREEK REACH DB2-3 AND WEST OF UPSTREAM REACHES
                                                                   Assessment Results and
Criterion                  Site Specific Assessment Direction
                                                                   Design Recommendations
Overview of Conditions in Vicinity:
• ~60m across Reach DB2-4, with no riparian community; no defined channel; flow dissipates through
  active agricultural field.
•
1. Hydraulics              • Required for segment crossing channel


2. Fluvial             • Required
   Geomorphology


3. Stormwater          • Required
   Management          • Runoff from crossing not to enter either
   Requirements          channel system directly
4. Fisheries           • Open bottom structure required


5. Geotechnical        • Required
   and
   Hydrogeology

6. Wildlife Passage    • Design opening for herptile and medium-
                         sized mammal passage
7. Vegetation          • Restoration of immediate vicinity of
   Management            crossing

8. Species at Risk     • Not applicable at this time


9. Road Design         • Urban cross-section in vicinity of
                         channel crossing

10. Natural Heritage   • Identified parallel to tributary; to be
    System Trails        located for safe intersection with road
                         and near outer limit of NHS
                       • Identified along southern edge of east-
                         west linkage component; to be located
                         for safe intersection with road and south
                         of woodland
Recommended            • Summarize dimensions, key features
Design Criteria
